content:
TITLE: Rendering BPMN 2.0 XML Diagram with bpmn-js in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use bpmn-js to render a BPMN 2.0 diagram from an XML string. It initializes a BpmnJS viewer, imports the XML, and handles potential rendering errors.  The 'xml' variable should contain a valid BPMN 2.0 XML string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const xml = '...'; // my BPMN 2.0 xml
const viewer = new BpmnJS({
  container: 'body'
});

try {
  const { warnings } = await viewer.importXML(xml);

  console.log('rendered');
} catch (err) {
  console.log('error rendering', err);
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Attaching and Detaching bpmn-js Viewer in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to dynamically attach and detach a bpmn-js viewer to and from a specific HTML element. It initializes a BpmnJS instance, attaches it to an element with the ID 'container', and then detaches it. Requires a DOM element with id 'container'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const viewer = new BpmnJS();

// attach it to some element
viewer.attachTo('#container');

// detach the panel
viewer.detach();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies with npm
DESCRIPTION: This shell command is used to install all the necessary dependencies for the bpmn-js project.  It uses the npm package manager to fetch and install packages specified in the project's package.json file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building and Testing bpmn-js with npm
DESCRIPTION: This shell command builds the bpmn-js library and runs all the associated tests. It typically executes build scripts and testing frameworks defined in the project's package.json file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm run all
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting a Local bpmn-js Modeler Instance with npm
DESCRIPTION: This shell command starts a single local instance of the bpmn-js modeler. It's commonly used for development and testing purposes, allowing users to interact with the modeler in a local environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Full Development Setup for bpmn-js with npm
DESCRIPTION: This shell command initiates the full development setup for bpmn-js. It usually involves starting development servers, file watchers, and other tools necessary for an efficient development workflow.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning Git Repositories
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to clone the bpmn-js, diagram-js, and bpmn-moddle repositories from GitHub into a local directory. It uses the `git clone` command with the respective repository URLs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/docs/project/SETUP.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone git@github.com:bpmn-io/bpmn-js.git
git clone git@github.com:bpmn-io/diagram-js.git
git clone git@github.com:bpmn-io/bpmn-moddle.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Project Directory Structure
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates the desired directory structure after linking the dependent projects. The `diagram-js` and `bpmn-moddle` projects should be linked within the `node_modules` directory of the `bpmn-js` project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/docs/project/SETUP.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plain
CODE:
```
.
├─bpmn-js
│   └─node_modules
│       ├─diagram-js <link>
│       └─bpmn-moddle <link>
├─diagram-js
├─bpmn-moddle
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: CopyPaste Service Modifications in bpmn-js
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet documents the breaking changes related to the `CopyPaste` service in bpmn-js. It involves removing `ModelCloneHelper`, adding `ModdleCopy` service, and changing events for property cloning.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
`CopyPaste`: remove `ModelCloneHelper` in favor of `ModdleCopy` service, remove `property.clone` event, add `moddleCopy.canCopyProperties`, `moddleCopy.canCopyProperty` and `moddleCopy.canSetCopiedProperty` event
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: BpmnRules Changes in bpmn-js
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet highlights the breaking changes in `BpmnRules` related to element pasting. It removes `elements.paste` rule in favor of `elements.create` and removes `element.paste` rule.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
`BpmnRules`: removed `elements.paste` rule in favor of `elements.create` rule
* `BpmnRules`: removed `element.paste` rule
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ElementFactory Modifications in bpmn-js
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the changes made to `ElementFactory` regarding element creation. It indicates the usage of `attrs.di` property instead of `attrs.colors` for fill and stroke.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
`ElementFactory`: use `attrs.di` property instead of `attrs.colors` for fill and stroke when creating element through `ElementFactory#createBpmnElement`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking for `createElementsBehavior` Hint in bpmn-js
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet describes how to prevent additional behavior on create after paste. The user is recommended to check for the `createElementsBehavior` hint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/blob/develop/CHANGELOG.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
To prevent additional behavior on create after paste you should check for the `createElementsBehavior` hint, cf. [`bf180321`](https://github.com/bpmn-io/bpmn-js/commit/bf180321a3a40428c3f87b639b87cc3fc578066e#diff-2f0de25761fb7459e88071f83fd845c5R22)
```
